abstract.text: LHCb is a dedicated heavy flavour physics precision experiment at the LHC searching for New Physics (NP) beyond the Standard Model (SM) through the study of very rare decays of beauty and charm-flavoured hadrons and precision measurements of CP-violating observables.
In this review I will present a selection of recent precision measurements of CP-violating observables in the decays of beauty and charm-flavoured hadrons.
These measurements are based on an integrated luminosity of up to 1.0 fb −1 collected by LHCb in 2011.

body_text.text: Introduction

The LHCb detector has been taking data with high efficiency during the last three years of operation at the LHC, producing a wealth of exciting physics results, which have made an impact on the flavour physics landscape and proved the concept of a dedicated heavy flavour spectrometer in the forward region at a hadron collider.
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: The LHC is the world's most intense source of b hadrons.

body_text.text: As in the case of the Tevatron, a complete spectrum of b hadrons is available, including B s , B c mesons and b baryons, such as Λ b .
body_text.section: was

body_text.text: At the nominal LHC design luminosity of 10 34 cm −2 s −1 , multiple pp collisions within the same bunch crossing (so-called pile-up) would significantly complicate the b decay-vertex reconstruction and flavour tagging, and increase the combinatorial background.
body_text.section: was

body_text.text: For this reason the detector was designed to operate at a reduced luminosity.
body_text.section: was

body_text.text: The luminosity at LHCb is locally controlled by transverse displacement of the beams (so-called "levelling") to yield L = 4 × 10 32 cm −2 s −1 (approximately a factor of two above the original LHCb design value) at which the average event pile-up per visible crossing is ∼2.
body_text.section: was

body_text.text: Running at relatively low luminosity has the additional advantage of reducing detector occupancy in the arXiv:1301.3082v1 [hep-ex] 14 Jan 2013 tracking systems and limiting radiation damage effects.
body_text.section: was

body_text.text: The dominant bb-production mechanism at the LHC is through gluon-gluon fusion in which the momenta of the incoming partons are strongly asymmetric in the pp centre-of-mass frame.
body_text.section: was

body_text.text: As a consequence, the bb pair is boosted along the direction of the higher momentum gluon, and both b hadrons are produced in the same forward (or backward) direction in the pp centre-of-mass frame.
body_text.section: was

body_text.text: The detector is therefore designed as a singlearm forward spectrometer covering the pseudorapidity range 2 < η < 5, which ensures a high geometric efficiency for detecting all the decay particles from one b hadron together with decay products from the accompanying b hadron to be used as a flavour tag.
body_text.section: was

body_text.text: Measurement of the B s mixing phase

The CP-violating phase φ s between B 0 s -B 0 s mixing and the b → ccs decay amplitude of the B s meson is determined with a flavour tagged, angular analysis of the decay B 0 s → J/ψφ, with J/ψ → µ + µ − and φ → K + K − .
body_text.section: Measurement of the B s mixing phase

body_text.text: This phase originates from the interference between the amplitudes for a B s (B s ) to decay directly into the final state J/ψφ or to first mix into B s (B s ) and then decay.
body_text.section: Measurement of the B s mixing phase

body_text.text: In the SM, φ s is predicted to be [3].

body_text.text: However, NP could significantly modify this prediction if new particles contribute to the B 0 s -B 0 s box diagram.
body_text.section: Measurement of the B s mixing phase

body_text.text: The CDF and D0 collaborations [4,5] have reported measurements of the B s mixing phase based on approximately 11,000 B 0 s → J/ψφ candidates from an integrated luminosity of 9.6 fb −1 (i.e. the full CDF Run II dataset) and 6,500 B 0 s → J/ψφ candidates from 8 fb −1 , respectively.
body_text.section: Measurement of the B s mixing phase

body_text.text: Both results are compatible with the SM expectation at approximately one standard deviation in the (φ s , ∆Γ s ) plane.
body_text.section: Measurement of the B s mixing phase

body_text.text: LHCb has presented results based on a sample that contains approximately 21,200 B 0 s → J/ψφ candidates from an integrated luminosity of 1.0 fb −1 [6].
body_text.section: Measurement of the B s mixing phase

body_text.text: Besides having a very large and clean signal yield, LHCb also benefits from an excellent proper time resolution to resolve fast B s oscillations, which is measured to be ∼45 fs, compared to a B s oscillation period of ∼350 fs.

body_text.text: The other key experimental ingredient is flavour tagging, which is performed by reconstructing the charge of the b-hadron accompanying the B meson under study.
body_text.section: Measurement of the B s mixing phase

body_text.text: The analysis uses an opposite-side flavour tagger based on four different signatures, namely high p T muons, electrons and kaons, and the net charge of an inclusively reconstructed secondary vertex, with a combined effective tagging power of ∼2.4%.

body_text.text: This is accomplished by performing an unbinned maximum likelihood fit to the candidate invariant mass, decay time, initial B s flavour and the decay angles in the so-called transversity frame [7].
body_text.section: Measurement of the B s mixing phase

body_text.text: This is the world's most precise measurement of φ s and the first direct observation for a non-zero value for ∆Γ s .

body_text.text: CP violation in charm
The charm sector is an interesting place to probe for the presence of NP because CP violation is expected to be small in the SM.
body_text.section: CP violation in charm

body_text.text: In particular, in singly Cabibbo suppressed decays, such as D → π + π − or D → K + K − , NP could manifest itself through the interference between tree-level and penguin diagrams.
body_text.section: CP violation in charm

body_text.text: LHCb has collected very large samples of charm: one in every ten LHC interaction results in the production of a charm hadron, of which 1-2 kHz are written to storage and are available for offline analysis.

body_text.text: Conclusion
This contribution has reviewed measurements of CP violation in charm and beauty decays performed by LHCb using up to 1.0 fb −1 of data collected in 2011.
body_text.section: Conclusion

body_text.text: In the B 0 s system LHCb has obtained the world's most precise measurement of the mixing phase φ s and the first direct observation for a non-zero value for ∆Γ s .
body_text.section: Conclusion

body_text.text: Important milestones have been reached in the measurement of the weak phase γ both from decays at tree level and from those where new physics could contribute through loops.
body_text.section: Conclusion

body_text.text: The large charm production cross-section at the LHC has allowed for a dramatic improvement in sensitivity to CP violating effects.
body_text.section: Conclusion

body_text.text: During the 2012 run at √ s = 8 TeV, another 2.1fb −1 of data were collected, which will allow LHCb to increase the precision on the results presented here and pursue new analyses to understand precisely the nature of CP violation in charm and beauty and hopefully find signs of new physics.
body_text.section: Conclusion
